Working with the Topic Pane

When you click the Topic tab, existing topics and responses display in the upper pane of the project view window. The Topic menu item also becomes available on the menu bar. Double-clicking a topic and response shows its properties.

All topics and responses shown in the upper pane:

  • Are attached to the folder selected from the application folder hierarchy.

  • Match the filter selected from the Filter drop-down list box.

  • Match the depth specified by the All Descendants button.

Choosing a Tree or List Format

When the Tree Display button is selected on the toolbar, each topic appears on the upper pane as an expandable topic tree, with the responses as its branches. The tree displays the relationships between the topic, its responses, and any replies to the responses. Each topic is preceded by an icon that shows a comment with an opened envelope in the lower left corner, while each response is preceded by an Envelope icon. The tree format, which is the default format, also allows you to move or share topics.

Clicking an unexpanded branch of a topic tree expands it; clicking it again collapses it. Double-clicking a topic expands or collapses its branches. Selecting Expand All and Collapse All from the Topic menu or context menu completely expands or collapses all trees.

The tree format uses special icons for topics and responses. It includes unopened envelope icon if the topic or response has not been read or has a response that has not been read somewhere in its branches.

When the List Display button is selected on the toolbar, information in the upper pane appears in list format. When this format is selected, the default order for the topics and responses is their tree order; however, no relationships are shown. The list format allows you to:

  • Sort topics and responses by any column header.

  • Filter both topics and responses, controlling the contents of the Topic pane.

Using the Topic Pane

From the Topic pane, you can perform a variety of operations, including:

View unread items

In both tree and list format, new topics and responses remain in boldface type until you open the Topic Properties dialog, and read them or mark them as read or unread. To mark items as read or unread, use the Mark as Read or Mark as Unread commands on the Topic menu or context menu. In tree format, you can mark entire threads with the Mark Thread As Read and Mark Thread as Unread commands.

View properties

To see the properties of a specific topic or response, double-click it.

Review topic status

In list format, the icon that appears with a topic or response shows its status – that is, whether it is active or inactive.

Review topic priority level

In list format, the icon that appears with a topic shows its priority level. The priority level may be high, normal, or low.

Move topic threads

In tree format, you can move a topic thread from one application folder to another by dragging it. You can also move a topic and its responses to other views or projects that use the same server configuration.

Share topic threads

In tree format, you can share a topic thread in one application folder with another folder by pressing Ctrl, then dragging the topic to the second folder. You can also share a topic and its responses with other views or projects, as long as they use the same server configuration.

Filter data

In list format, you can rearrange topic fields, show different fields, sort up to four columns, use group bands, and apply queries to the data in the list. You can also save the operations you have performed on the data as a query or filter. To perform these actions from the context menu, right-click a column header to display the menu.

Sort topics

In list format, you can click a topic column header to perform a sort based on the value in that column. The sort is usually in ascending numeric or alphanumeric order, depending on the data. To change the sort order from ascending to descending (or vice versa), click the header a second time. A triangle indicating the direction of the sort appears on the header of the primary sort column.

Default columns for topics and responses are:

  • Topic Number: Number assigned by the application.

  • Created By: Name of the person who entered the topic or response.

  • Created Time: Date and time the topic or response was entered.

  • Title: Subject of the topic or response.

  • Content: First few words of the text.

  • Status: Status classifications include Active (default) and Closed.

  • Priority: Priorities include Low, Normal, and High.

Refresh view

Press Shift + F5 to refresh the entire view (all item lists in all tabs as well as the application folder hierarchy). Press F5 to refresh only the Topic list. Press Ctrl + F5 to refresh the list and collapse all open groups simultaneously.
